member.name: T:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.AdvancedBooleanToVisibilityConverter
member.summary: Used to convert a bool to WPF visibility. By default, true = Visible and false = Collapsed, just like BooleanToVisibilityConverter. You can however specify a different behavior by passing one of the ConversionType as the ConverterParameter.

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.AdvancedBooleanToVisibilityConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts a bool value to a Visibility value. By default true = Visible and false = Collapsed, but you can use the ConverterParameter with one of the ConversionType values to change that behavior.
member.param: Converter Parameter: One of ConversionType (optional -- ConversionType.Default will be used if this parameter is null)
member.returns: One of the Visibility values, depending on source value and conversion type.

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.AdvancedBooleanToVisibilityConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Reverse conversion - NOT IMPLEMENTED.

member.name: T:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.AdvancedBooleanToVisibilityConverter.ConversionType
member.summary: Options for the ConverterParameter.

member.summary: Converts true to Visible, false to Collapsed.

member.name: F:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.AdvancedBooleanToVisibilityConverter.ConversionType.TrueVisible_FalseHidden
member.summary: Converts true to Visible, false to Hidden.

member.summary: Default option.

member.name: T:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.Windows32.User32
member.summary: A collection of wrapped User32 dll calls.
A collection of wrapped User32 dll calls.
A collection of wrapped User32 dll calls.

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.Windows32.User32.GetKeyState(System.Int32)
member.summary: The GetKeyState function retrieves the status of the specified virtual key. The status specifies whether the key is up, down, or toggled (on, offâ€”alternating each time the key is pressed).
member.param:
[in] Specifies a virtual key. If the desired virtual key is a letter or digit (A through Z, a through z, or 0 through 9), nVirtKey must be set to the ASCII value of that character. For other keys, it must be a virtual-key code.
If a non-English keyboard layout is used, virtual keys with values in the range ASCII A through Z and 0 through 9 are used to specify most of the character keys. For example, for the German keyboard layout, the virtual key of value ASCII O (0x4F) refers to the "o" key, whereas VK_OEM_1 refers to the "o with umlaut" key.
member.returns:
The return value specifies the status of the specified virtual key, as follows:
If the high-order bit is 1, the key is down; otherwise, it is up. If the low-order bit is 1, the key is toggled. A key, such as the CAPS LOCK key, is toggled if it is turned on. The key is off and untoggled if the low-order bit is 0. A toggle key's indicator light (if any) on the keyboard will be on when the key is toggled, and off when the key is untoggled.

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.Windows32.User32.IsKeyDown(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Checks if the key is actually being held down.
member.returns: true if the key is down; otherwise false

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.Windows32.User32.IsKeyToggled(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Checks if the key is toggled on.
member.returns: true if the key is toggled; otherwise false

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.OnColorChanged(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Anytime dependency property SelectedColor is changed, this Updates ARGB, HSV, and hex values accordingly, which are inextricably intertwined.
member.param: Handles SelectedColor dependency property changed events

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.UpdateColorHSB(System.Object,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Used to update color when Hue, Saturation, or Brightness dependency properties change. Also updates slider thumbs and widget rotations accordingly.
member.param: Handles dependency property changed events, for Hue, Saturation, or Brightness properties

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.UpdateColorRGB(System.Object,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Used to update color when Red, Green, or Blue dependency properties change. Also updates slider thumbs and Widget rotations accordingly.
member.param: Handles dependency property changed events, for A, R, G, B dependency properties

member.name: F:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.SelectedColorChangedEvent
member.summary: Routed event trigered when the selected color changes.

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.OnRenderSizeChanged(System.Windows.SizeChangedInfo)
member.summary: Called when the render size is changed.

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.CreateHueBitmap(System.Windows.Size,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a color wheel image.
member.param: Size of the bitmap to create, in pixels, rounded down.
member.returns: Created bitmap

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.CreateSaturationValueBitmap(System.Windows.Size,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates the background image to be used on the sat/value triangle. This function allocates new memory and should be called when the widget is resized. Also, this function initializes the _triangleBackground... member variables.
member.param: Size of the bitmap to create, in pixels, rounded down.
member.returns: Created bitmap

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.UpdateSaturationValueBitmap
member.summary: Recalculates the values of the pixels in the cached triangle background bitmap. This function assumes that CreateSaturationValueBitmap has been called.

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.UpdateLinearGradientBrush
member.summary: Redefines the LinearGradientBrush colors used as a background in the multipurpose slider according to the current channel selection. Each channel resets TopColor and BottomColor. If Hue is selected, 5 gradientStops are added (Standard hue gradient def.)

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.OnMouseMove(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles movements of mouse while left mouse button is held down. Assumes mouse has been captured by a GraphicChooser element (SV Triangle, Slider, or Hue Circle).
member.param: Mouse Event Argument, checks if mouse moved during left click
Graphical slider object that raised the event

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.OnMouseDown(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles mouse click on a GraphicChooser Element. The GraphicChooser element captures mouse elements including: SV Triangle, Slider bar, or Hue Circle.
member.param: Mouse Event Argument, checking for left mouse button click
Graphical slider object that raised the event

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.OnMouseUp(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles mouse button release after clicking a GraphicChooser Element. The Graphic Chooser element releases mouse capture (elements: SV Triangle, Slider, or Hue Circle).
member.param: Mouse Event Argument, checking for left mouse button release
Graphical slider object that raised the event

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.HandleHueClick(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Hue Picker Control from Mouse Event. Accepts relative mouse position as point, called by mouse events, Sets value of Hue between 0 and 360 degrees.
member.param: (X,Y)Point of mouse event relative to Hue Circle Slider

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.HandleTriangleClick(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: SV Picker Control from Mouse Event. Accepts relative mouse position as point, called by mouse events, Sets value of Brightness between 0 and 100 percent, Sets value of Saturation between 0 and 100 percent, Saturation is dependent on brightness.
member.param: (X,Y)Point of mouse event relative to SV Chooser (Center Triangle)

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.HandleSliderClick(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Multipurpose Slider Control from Mouse Event. Accepts relative mouse position as point, called by mouse events, Sets value of a Color (A, R, G, or B) between 0-255. Sets value of Hue between 0-360. Sets value of Saturation or Brightness between 0-100.
member.param: (X,Y)Point of mouse event relative to Multipurpose Slider

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.SetSlider
member.summary: Redefines MultiSlider appearance according to channel: Re-evaluates slider coloring and line position according to a selected property.

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.SVCircle(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Thumb indicator position control for SV picker. Accepts saturation and brightness arguments. Triggers changes in SatPosition and BrightPosition which the x and y position of the thumb are bound to, respectively.

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.GraphicalPicker.HandleSliderLine(System.Int32)
member.summary: Thumb indicator position control for Multipurpose Slider. Accepts A, R, G, or B values. Triggers changes in SliderData which the y position of the thumb is bound to.
member.param: Numerical value from selected channel property for slider height.

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.EditTextBlock.OnMouseLeftButtonDown(System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when an unhandled Â routed event is raised on this element. Implement this method to add class handling for this event.
member.param: The that contains the event data. The event data reports that the left mouse button was pressed.

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.EditTextBlock.OnMouseLeftButtonUp(System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when an unhandled Â routed event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class. Implement this method to add class handling for this event.
member.param: The that contains the event data. The event data reports that the left mouse button was released.

member.name: P:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.EditTextBlock.EditText
member.summary: Gets or sets the edit text if different from the Text. Use this property if the edit text must be different from the display text. This is a dependency property.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the EditTextBlock is editing. This is a dependency property.
member.value: true if the EditTextBlock is editing; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.EditTextBlock.IsSelectedInternal
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the EditTextBlock is selected.
member.value: true if the EditTextBlock is selected; otherwise, false.

member.param: The final area within the parent that this element should use to arrange itself and its children.
member.returns: The actual size used.

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.EditTextBlockAdorner.GetVisualChild(System.Int32)
member.summary: Overrides , and returns a child at the specified index from a collection of child elements.
member.param: The zero-based index of the requested child element in the collection.
member.returns: The requested child element. This should not return null; if the provided index is out of range, an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.EditTextBlockAdorner.MeasureOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, measures the size in layout required for child elements and determines a size for the derived class.
member.param: The available size that this element can give to child elements. Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the element will size to whatever content is available.
member.returns: The size that this element determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of child element sizes.

member.name: P:Emergent.Toolbench.UI.Common.WPF.EditTextBlockAdorner.VisualChildrenCount
